issue.title: RFC: Refactoring to support PHPUnit 10
issue.body:
PHPUnit 10 has recently been released and it includes improvements to the testing framework along with a new Event system. Unfortunately, it also brings along a breaking change that causes this library to no longer work. Specifically, the `PHPUnit\Framework\TestCase::setName` method has been marked as final and can no longer be overridden. Fortunately, I believe the event system could simplify what we'd have to do.

A tl;dr is that we create an [`Extension`](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/3126416bca5955bdb9cebf21aeb233ddc1a8418d/src/Runner/Extension/Extension.php) that invokes `EventLoop::getSuspension()->suspend()` in an appropriate event. The first thought is the [`PHPUnit\Event\Events\Test\Finished`](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/3126416bca5955bdb9cebf21aeb233ddc1a8418d/src/Event/Events/Test/Lifecycle/Finished.php) event.

If this sounds like a good place to start I can work on a new branch for PHPUnit 10 support in the next week or two.

issue.title: Output which EventLoop driver is being used with version information
Allow specifying a more complete HttpServer configuration
issue.body:
There are pieces of amphp/http-server that can be configured but we do not expose a mechanism to do that. We should adjust the `HttpServerConfiguration` and corresponding `HttpServerFactory` to allow pertinent options to be configured on the created `SocketHttpServer`. Based on initial review of amphp/http-server we'll have to adjust various factories used when creating the `SocketHttpServer`.

## List of Configuration

- [ ] Max connections allowed
- [ ] Max connections per IP address

issue.title: Bootstrap and configuration should allow source directories to be profile aware
issue.body:
Currently the `annotated-container.xml` file marks any directories it finds in `autoload-dev` with a `packagePrivate=true` attribute. While no functionality currently uses this value it was expected that later features would make use of this to selectively choose directories to skip in certain situations. Specifically, scanning the `vendor/` directory for third-party libraries integrating with Annotated Container was expected to utilize this. However, the way `vendor/` scanning was initially conceived has been changed. In addition, adding the concept of what `packagePrivate=true` actually means to the Bootstrap had many questions/challenges.

We should remove this attribute and replace it with a `profiles` attribute. The `profiles` would contain a comma-separated list of profiles that must be active to scan the given directory. If no `profiles` attribute has been provided then

issue.title: Allow bootstrap observing to be profile aware
issue.body:
Bootstrap observers could benefit from knowing what profiles are active. For example, a cache busting observer could be added that clears out any cached container definition before compilation in appropriate profiles, say 'dev' or 'test', but allows the cached definition in 'prod'.

In addition to adding this data on to the appropriate `Bootstrap\Observer` interface methods. We should also consider whether to allow configured observers to define what profiles they're active for since this seems to be useful enough to expose as a first-class citizen.
